中国: China, Chūgoku region (western part of Honshu comprising the prefectures of Okayama, Hiroshima, Yamaguchi, Tottori and Shimane), central part of a country
太刀: long sword (as opposed to the shorter katana), tachi, sabre-like sword worn on the hip with the blade facing down
済ませる: to finish, to make an end of, to get through with
錦上: crowning beauty with even greater glory
山荘: mountain villa, mountain retreat, mountain cottage
一泊: (staying) one night, overnight stay, overnight rental
鼻先: tip of nose, before one's eyes, under one's nose
懲役: penal servitude, imprisonment with hard labor (hard labour)
味わう: to taste, to savor, to savour
遵守: observance (of laws, rules, etc.), adherence, obeying
辻風呂: bathtub placed on the roadside and rented to customers
励ます: to encourage, to cheer on, to cheer (someone) up
存じる: to know, to be aware (of), to be acquainted (with)
四畳半: four and a half tatami mats, four-and-a-half-mat room, small room esp. for assignations
把握: grasp (of the situation, meaning, etc.), understanding, control
偏る: to lean (to one side), to incline, to be unbalanced (e.g. diet)
捨てる: to throw away, to cast away, to dump
厚顔抄: Kogansho (1691 commentary on the songs of the Kojiki and Nihon Shoki; by Keichu)
廃れる: to go out of use, to become obsolete, to die out, to go out of fashion, to go out of style; to decline (e.g. of morals), to be lost, to go into decline (of a town, business, etc.)
背負う: to carry on one's back, to be burdened with, to take responsibility for
突如: suddenly, all of a sudden, unexpectedly
磨く: to polish, to shine, to burnish
夜爪: cutting one's nails at night (said to cause one to miss the deathbed of one's parents)
圭璧: ritual jades worn by feudal lords in ancient China
掲げる: to put up (a notice, sign, etc.), to hang out (e.g. a banner), to fly (e.g. a flag)
傷つける: to wound, to injure, to hurt someone's feelings (pride, etc.)
雄刈萱: Cymbopogon tortilis var. goeringii (variety of grass closely related to lemongrass)
問題: question (e.g. on a test), problem, problem (e.g. societal, political)
